    HackerRank launches job search platform HackerRank Jobs

    By
    J Vignesh
    , ET Bureau|
    12 Jan, 2016, 10.34PM IST
    BENGALURU: HackerRank, a tech recruiting company, has launched HackerRank Jobs, to bridge the gap between the applicant and recruiter.

    HackerRank conducted a survey among its coder community and found out that slow response time from the recruiter, lack of transparency on salary, lack of clarity on the job profile and the company expectations from the employee were the pain points for the applicants.

    "Being a programmer and having faced similar situation while looking for a job, inspired me to solve this issue for the programmers and establish a better ecosystem. We think not only from a recruiter's perspective but also from a coder's viewpoint and tried to create a user interface that will join both the ends of the system" said Harishankar Karunadhi, co-founder of HackerRank. The HackerRank Jobs comes with a mobile app.

    Candidates can request a code challenge from companies and then solve the challenge and share their availability for interviews. Companies have up to five days to schedule an interview with the top-performing engineers, and candidates who do not pass the hiring bar will be notified. The app gives salary information and promises response to the applicant within five business days.

    "We are reinventing the way that engineers apply to jobs," said Vivek Ravisankar, co-founder and CEO of HackerRank. HackerRank Jobs is presently available in Apple App Store and Google Play Store, as well as on the HackerRank website. Developers can currently search for jobs in the San Francisco Bay Area, New York, and Bengaluru. Additional regions will be available by the end of March 2016, said the company.

    The platform already has 15 Indian companies and 18 US based companies listed on it. The companies include VMware, Evernote, Palantir Technologies, Fidessa and Elementum.
    READ MORE :Play Store | Palantir | HackerRank | Google | Evernote | Apple | App Store
